at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.server.connections

Class Connection

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.server.connections.Connection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CarConnection, PhoneConnection

    public abstract class Connection
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This abstract runnable provides basic functionality to communicate with any device that is connected to this server via a TCP-connection.
    This class holds the reference to exactly one TCP-connection with another device, which means that every connection is handled in its own thread.
    Basic functionalities are:
    -) Write and read Strings to and from the TCP-Socket that connects the server to the device.
    -) Write and read JSON Strings to and from the TCP-Socket that can be generated by HashMaps.
    -) inform the main thread about certain events via the operationQueue.

    The class also contains a list of listeners that can register themselves to get informed about data that is received via this classes TCP-connection.

    Following is a list of JSON-Keywords, that can be part of a message (value range not enforced by server):
    Key Value range/type Description
    id long or String to register at the server. A String stands for a phone-ID, a long stands for a car-ID
    connect 0...99999 to connect a phone to a car in order to control it.
    0 represents a request to disconnect.
    state -1...2 to get informed about id and connect requests
    (-1 not allowed, 0 not connected to a phone, 1 identified, 2 connected to a phone)
    request String to request certain information (e.g. ID)
    props List<String> a List of Strings that contains all the cars properties.
    The list can contain: "camera", "lights", "winkers", "frontDistanceSensor", "sideDistanceSensors", "velocitySensor"
    phnCtrl 0...1 to change between control via car-gamepad and linked phone
    acc -128...127 the acceleration for the car
    steer -128...127 the steering angle for the car
    yaw -128...127 the horizontal rotation angle for the cars gimbal
    ptch -128...127 the vertical rotation angle for the cars gimbal
    fLts 0...1 toggles the front lights
    bLts 0...1 toggles the back lights
    dynLts 0...1 toggles the lights between manual and dynamic mode
    lWnkr 0...1 activates the left winker
    rWnkr 0...1 activates the right winker
    stop 0...1 to send a stop signal to the car, in case the connected phone gets disconnected
    uSSen 0...65535 the cars ultrasonic-sensor-data
    lISen 0...255 the cars left-infrared-sensor-data
    rISen 0...255 the cars right-infrared-sensor-data
    hSen 0...255 the cars hall-sensor-data
    Author:
    Boeck

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean closeConnection
      True, if the runnable should close the connection and finish, otherwise false.
      private java.net.Socket connection
      Holds the connection itself.
      private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> forwardMessageMap
      Contains the JSON-map that should be forwarded to the device that is linked to this device via the server.
      private java.io.InputStreamReader inputStream
      Holds the inputStream to read from the connected device.
      private java.util.Collection<IDataListener> listeners
      The set of DataListeners that want to be informed about new incoming data.
      private static org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger logger
      The logger that is used for logging messages.
      private java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<QueueElement> operationQueue
      The operationQueue can be written to, to inform the main-thread about certain events and send information-relevant data.
      private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> outputMessageMap
      Contains the key-value-pairs for the JSON-String, to be sent to the connected device.
      private java.io.OutputStreamWriter outputStream
      Holds the output-stream to write to the connected device.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Connection

        public Connection(java.net.Socket connection,
                  java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<QueueElement> operationQueue)
        Used to initialize this class with a Socket (the connection itself) and a LinkedBlockingQueue for communicating with the main-thread.
        Parameters:
        connection - the Socket for this class. Needs to be pre-configured (priority, read-timeout, etc.), since this class does not provide means to configure the Socket.
        operationQueue - this LinkedBlockingQueue is used to inform the main-thread about certain events and send information-relevant data.

      • writeToOperationQueue

        protected boolean writeToOperationQueue(EOperationType operationType)
        Creates a new QueueElement with the passed operation-type and this class as parameters and puts it on the operationQueue.
        Parameters:
        operationType - the operationType for the new QueueElement
        Returns:

      • readFromStream

        protected java.lang.String readFromStream()
        Reads a maximum of 500 bytes from the Sockets InputStream, converts it into a String, and returns it.
        If an IOException occurs, this runnable will render invalid and therefore finish.
        Returns:
        the String that was received or null, if nothing was received before an IOException occurred (including a simple Timeout).

      • readFromStreamToHashMap

        protected java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> readFromStreamToHashMap()
        Reads a maximum of 500 bytes from the Sockets InputStream, tries to convert it into a HashMap, and returns it.
        If an IOException occurs, this runnable will render invalid and therefore finish.
        Returns:
        the HashMap that was created or null, if nothing was received before an IOException occurred (including a simple Timeout).

      • writeToStream

        protected boolean writeToStream(java.lang.String outputMessage)
        Writes a String to the Sockets OutputStream for the connected device to receive it.
        Parameters:
        outputMessage - the String that should be sent to the connected device.
        Returns:
        true, if the write to the outputStream was successful, otherwise false.

      • writeFromMapToStream

        protected boolean writeFromMapToStream(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> messageMap)
        Converts the passed HashMap to a JSON-String and writes that String to the Sockets outputStream for the connected device to receive it.
        Parameters:
        messageMap - the HashMap that should be converted to a JSON-String and sent to the connected device.
        Returns:
        true, if the write to the outputStream was successful, otherwise false.

      • forwardMessageToDevice

        protected boolean forwardMessageToDevice(Connection conn)
        Converts this objects forwardMessageMap to a JSON-String and writes that String to the Sockets outputStream of the passed Connection.
        Parameters:
        conn - the Connection that the forwardMessageMap should be written to.
        Returns:
        true, if the write to the Socket of the passed Connection was successful, otherwise false.

      • sendOutputMessageMap

        public boolean sendOutputMessageMap()
        Converts this objects outputStream to a JSON-String and writes that String to the Sockets outputStream for the connected device to receive it.
        Returns:
        true, if the write to the Sockets outputStream was successful, otherwise false.

      • register

        protected java.lang.Object register()
        This method waits until the connected device has sent identification information. It also requests identification every 5 seconds that no identification information has been received. While waiting for identification of the connected device, all other received information is discarded.
        If identification has been received, the main-thread is informed about the event. In this case, the connected device must not yet be informed about the success of the operation. This is handled by the main-thread in order to be able to conform with the Servers whitelist.
        Returns:
        the received id

      • closeConnection

        protected void closeConnection()
        Tries to gracefully close the connection, set the closeConnection-flag to true and informs the main-thread about this event through the operationQueue.

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
